title: of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities 

(Active Implantable Medical Devices) (Amendment) Regulations 2020. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, Regulations 2(3) and 20 of the European 
Communities (Medical Devices) (Amendment) Regulations 2001 (S.I. No. 444 
of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together 
as 
the European Communities (Active Implantable Medical Devices) 
Regulations 1994 to 2020 and shall be construed together as one.

title: of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the European Communities (Active Implantable 
Medical Devices) Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 253 of 1994); 

“Regulations of 2009” means the European Communities (Active Implantable 
Medical Devices) (Amendment) Regulations 2009 (S.I. No. 109 of 2009).

title: of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together
heading: 3. Article 7(5) of the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting
text_raw:
3. Article 7(5) of the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting 

“public health or patient safety or health” for “protection of health”. 

1 OJ No. L 189, 20.7.1990, p. 17. 
2 OJ No. L 117, 5.5.2017, p. 1. 
3 OJ No. L 130, 24.4.2020, p. 18. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th August, 2020.

title: of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together
heading: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by inserting after Article 21 the
text_raw:
4. The Principal Regulations are amended by inserting after Article 21 the 

following Article: 

“Information on incidents occurring following placing of devices on 
market

title: of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together
heading: 22. (1) The Competent Authority shall record and evaluate any
text_raw:
22. (1) The Competent Authority shall record and evaluate any 
information brought to its attention regarding the following incidents 
involving a device: 

(a) 

(b) 

any malfunction of or deterioration in the characteristics 
and performances of a device, as well as any inadequacy in 
the labelling or in the instructions for use which might lead 
to or might have led to the death of a patient or user or to a 
serious deterioration in his or her state of health; and 

technical or medical reason 

any 
the 
characteristics or performances of a device for the reasons 
referred to in paragraph (a), leading to systematic recall of 
devices of the same type by the manufacturer. 

in relation 

to 

(2) After carrying out an assessment, if possible together with the 
manufacturer or his or her authorised representative, the Competent 
Authority shall, without prejudice to Article 13(A), immediately inform 
the Commission and the other Member States of measures that have 
been taken or are contemplated to minimise recurrence of the incidents 
referred to in subarticle (1), including information on the underlying 
incidents.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 August, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [300]

title: of 2001), the Regulations of 2009 and these Regulations may be cited together
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to give effect to Regulation 59(1) of 
Regulation (EU) 2017/745 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 5 
April 2017, as amended by Regulation (EU) 2020/561 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 23 April 2020. In addition, these Regulations 
implement Article 8 of Council Directive 90/385/EEC of 20 June 1990 in the 
State. 

These Regulations amend the European Communities (Active Implantable 
Medical Devices) Regulations 1994. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Active 
Implantable Medical Devices) (Amendment) Regulations 2020.
